Article Title: Prime accused in Mumbai woman's murder arrested in Jammu
Article Text: JAMMU: Crime branch of Jammu & Kashmir Police arrested a native of Hisar, Haryana, for the alleged murder of a Mumbai woman in Aug, sources here said Friday. Officers, however, remained tight-lipped about the arrest of Sher Singh and said details would be shared within days.An unidentified gunman fired several rounds inside a physiotherapy centre on Aug 21, resulting in injuries to Mehjabeen Akil Sheikh and her sister Fatima, both from Malad (West) in Mumbai, and one Jaspreet Kaur of Ludhiana. They were admitted in JK Medicity Hospital by two individuals, who claimed they were injured in a road accident. Jaspreet, however, went missing from there and the sisters were transferred to a private medical college and later to Govt Medical College, Jammu, where Mehjabeen died on Aug 29.Subsequent investigation confirmed the women had suffered gunshot wounds. Police registered a murder case after Mehjabeen's death. On Sept 19, crime branch headquarters constituted a six-member SIT to investigate the killing.Police sources said SIT detained Fatima following her discharge for questioning on the firing at the Sainik Colony physiotherapy centre where suspicious activities had allegedly been going on for some time. These activities were allegedly overlooked by three cops, including an SHO, who have since been suspended.SIT will probe into the circumstances leading to the murder, and role of the three cops to pass it off as an accident.
Article Summary: Sher Singh, a native of Hisar, Haryana, arrested for alleged murder of a Mumbai woman in Aug. Officers, however, remained tight-lipped about the arrest of Sher Singh and said details would be shared within days. An unidentified gunman fired several rounds inside a physiotherapy centre on Aug 21.

Article Title: Bihar assembly elections: Two more parties join Mahagathbandhan; seat-sharing deal to get complex?
Article Text:
PM Modi’s 'Kosi' Jibe at Opposition Ignites Bihar Election Heat During MP Flats Inauguration

NEW DELHI: The seat-sharing negotiations for upcoming assembly elections in Bihar have become more complex as two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The situation is getting trickier as major parties are firm on their seat demands.The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.“Two more parties are expected to be part of the INDIA bloc soon and we all have to sacrifice our share of seats to accommodate the new partners.” State Congress president Rajesh Kumar told reporters after a discussion during a key meeting of INDIA bloc leaders at the official residence of RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav.Meanwhile, Congress insist that it cannot go below the 70 seats.VIP chief Mukesh Sahani, on the other hand, has demanded “60 seats plus the post of deputy CM” while the CPI-ML is pressing for at least 40 seats, pointing to its past performance.The RJD is also unwilling to contest on fewer than 150 seats.In 2020 assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal had contested on 144 seats, of which it won 75.Congress won 19 out of 70 seats.CPI-ML contested 19 seats and won 12.CPM contested 4 seats and was successful in winning 2 seats.CPI contested on 6 seats and won 2 seats.RJD's Tejashwi Yadav has already declared himself as the CM face of the opposition INDIA bloc.Addressing the rally in Ara town, the last stopover of the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra', Tejashwi questioned the Nitish Kumar government in Bihar for "frequently copying his ideas" and described it as a "copycat government". Ridiculing the government for copying his ideas, he said that at present he was moving ahead while the govt was behind him."Tejashwi aage-aage, Sarkar pichhe-pichhe. Original CM chahiye ki duplicate?" (Tejashwi is moving ahead while the govt is following him from behind. Do you want a duplicate CM or the original CM?), Tejashwi asked the crowd.
Article Summary: Two new parties - Jharkhand Mukti Morcha (JMM) and Pashupati Paras's LJP faction - joined the Mahagathbandhan alliance. The 243 seats will now be divided among eight parties -- Rashtriya Janata Dal, Congress, CPI, CPM, VIP, LJP (Paras) and JMM.

Article Title: Why forget such acts of generosity? Dialogue war erupts in Andhra assembly over TDP MLA Balakrishna's 'psycho' remarks
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly witnessed heated exchanges after Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MLA and veteran actor Nandamuri Balakrishna called former chief minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy a "psycho" during Assembly proceedings on Thursday, following a debate initiated by BJP MLA Kamineni Srinivas about the previous YSRCP government's alleged neglect of the Telugu film industry.The controversy erupted when Srinivas claimed that film industry representatives had difficulty meeting Jagan during his tenure as chief minister until megastar Chiranjeevi intervened.Balakrishna's interruption and controversial remarks against Jagan drew immediate condemnation from YSRCP leaders, who called his behavior disgraceful and unbecoming of a legislator."The Assembly is not a movie set for film-style dialogues," responded a YSRCP leader, criticizing Balakrishna for undermining the House's dignity.Former minister Perni Venkatramaiah (Nani) defended Jagan by highlighting instances of his support to Balakrishna, including assistance during the release of Akhanda and a firing incident at Balakrishna's residence."Why forget such acts of generosity? Is political gain more important than decency?" Nani questioned.Chiranjeevi issued a clarification about his role in addressing industry concerns during Jagan's tenure.He confirmed meeting Jagan over lunch after coordinating with then-Minister Perni Nani."Jagan listened with patience and responded positively," Chiranjeevi stated, noting that the subsequent revision in ticket pricing policy benefited films including Waltair Veerayya and Veera Simha Reddy.The clarification contradicted claims by TDP and Janasena leaders about Jagan's alleged dismissive attitude toward Tollywood.YSRCP leaders Ambati Rambabu and Margani Bharat criticized Chandrababu Naidu, Nara Lokesh, Pawan Kalyan, and Balakrishna for allegedly spreading false narratives."The truth has come out. Jagan always stood with the film industry. This opportunistic politics must end," stated Margani Bharat.The incident highlighted the ongoing political tensions in Andhra Pradesh, where even cinema-related matters become subjects of intense political debate.
Article Summary: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly witnessed heated exchanges after Telugu Desam Party (TDP) MLA Nandamuri Balakrishna called former chief minister YS Jagan Mohan Reddy a "psycho" The controversy erupted when Srinivas claimed that film industry representatives had difficulty meeting Jagan during his tenure as chief minister.

Article Title: Encounter specialist VC Sajjanar appointed as Hyderabad CP; Vijay Kumar new intelligence head
Article Text:
VC Sajjanar; Vijay Kumar





HYDERABAD: In a late-night order, the Telangana state government transferred 23 senior IPS officers, including the appointment of 1996-batch officer V.C. Sajjanar as the new Hyderabad Police Commissioner and 1997-batch officer Vijay Kumar as the new intelligence chief.The order came hours after the government appointed B. Shivadhar Reddy as the next in-charge Director General of Police (DGP) for Telangana. Sajjanar, who is currently posted as Managing Director of the Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC), replaces incumbent C.V. Anand, who has been appointed Special Chief Secretary (Home Department).Sajjanar, known as an encounter specialist, has been involved in several high-profile cases, including the 2019 gunning down of four accused in an encounter following the Disha rape and murder case while he was Commissioner of Cyberabad, and the gunning down of three suspects involved in the 1996 acid attack in Warangal when he was Warangal Superintendent of Police. He was chosen by the state government after considering various Additional Director General of Police rank officers.Similarly, ACB Director General of Police Vijay Kumar, known for maintaining a low profile and supervising the sensational Formula E case, has been appointed as Intelligence Chief, replacing incumbent Shivadhar Reddy.
Article Summary: The order came hours after the government appointed B. Shivadhar Reddy as the next in-charge Director General of Police for Telangana. Sajjanar, known as an encounter specialist, has been involved in several high-profile cases, including the 2019 gunning down of four accused in an encounter.
